importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news report indicates when the incident and related statements were made public, signaling a current event in police-community relations and public safety discourse.
The date of Doug Martin's NFL draft selection (31st overall in the first round) highlights a key milestone in his career, reflecting his early recognition as a top-tier talent.
This date marks a significant year in Martin's career when he achieved first-team All-Pro status and Pro Bowl selection, demonstrating sustained excellence in performance.
Martin's 2015 performance (1,402 yards, 6 TDs) was pivotal in reinforcing his reputation as a top running back and contributing to discussions about athlete performance and longevity.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from 2012 to 2018 covers Doug Martin's peak playing years with the Buccaneers, during which he established himself as a leading NFL running back and a franchise icon.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro NFL running back, died after a brief struggle with police during an investigation into a home break-in in Oakland.
Martin was 36 years old at the time of his death, and the cause of death has not been released, with an autopsy pending.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft from Boise State and had a storied career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors.
He finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, and was named one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history.
His death has sparked public concern about police interactions with athletes and the broader issue of police accountability in community settings.
The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, acknowledging Martin as an Oaklander with a distinguished career and a deep connection to the community.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, best known for his career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at age 36 after a brief struggle with Oakland police during an investigation into a home break-in. The incident occurred on Saturday, October 19, 2025, and Martin was transported to a hospital where he later passed away; the cause of death has not been released. Martin, selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft from Boise State, was a Pro Bowl and All-Pro honoree, and was named one of the top 50 players in Buccaneers franchise history. The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, highlighting Martin’s connection to the community. This event has raised broader concerns about police interactions with athletes and the need for accountability in law enforcement practices.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Struggle With Police During Arrest
